result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence and Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15). The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence and the other charge, Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jamie Hang was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Jamie Hang was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Jamie Hang was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing hearing on April 25, 2018 at 11:30 am.
Order to Vacate Deferred Judgment Agreement

MOTION TO VACATE DEFERRED JUDGMENT AGREEMENT - 
Defendant did not comply with the terms of community service, which is the basis of the State's motion to revoke the Deferred Judgment Agreement.
The Court grants the motion, vacates the Deferred Judgment Agreement and enters judgment of conviction on count 1, 1st degree recklessly endangering safety.
Court orders a Pre-sentence Investigation be submitted to the Court by April 13th.
Sentencing hearing set for 04-25-2018 at 11:00am.  
State to draft the necessary order.

Motion hearing on February 1, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Motion hearing on November 28, 2017 at 10:30 am.
All records scanned and verified.
Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 04-30-2016
Reminder Notice - Final Notice
It is hereby stipulated to by the parties that restitution in the amount of $500.00 will be paid by the defendant, Jamie Hang to the victim Michael Schram by December 31, 2015.
To Modify Sentence
to Modify Sentence
Motion hearing set for 03-05-2015 @ 8:30 a.m. BR-2.

NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, 1st degree recklessly endangering safety.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 3, hit and run.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 4, cause injury/operate under the influence.
The Court accepts the pleas, finds the defendant guilty and convicts him of counts 3 and 4.  On count 1, the Court withholds entry of judgment of conviction pursuant to a Deferred Judgment Agreement.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 5.  Motion granted.
On count 1, 1st degree recklessly endangering safety, the Court approves the Deferred Judgment Agreement for a period of 36 months.
Review date:  10-30-2017
On count 4, cause injury/operate under the influence, the defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for thirty (30) days, under the Huber Law, commencing on 12-30-14 at 6:00 p.m.
Defendant has credit for 1 day.
$300.00 fine plus costs imposed, total of $1,266.00, to be paid by 07-05-2015 or 25 days county jail for failure to pay.
Twelve (12) month DL revocation and Ignition Interlock ordered by the Court.
Alcohol assessment ordered.
On Count 3, hit and run, sentence is withheld and the defendant is placed on probation to DOC for eighteen (18) months.
Conditions of probation:
1) Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process;
2) Maintain absolute sobriety;
3) Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, job search or combination;
4) Spend three (3) months in the county jail, under the Huber Law, consecutive to the jail sentence imposed on count 4;
5) Spend additional four (4) months in the county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agents discretion and upon order of the court;
6) Pay court costs;
7) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC.
